title: i can only afford heating
story: Exclusive: I can only afford heating for two hours a day - soon I wont even be able to do thatAmanda Button said her gas bill is going up from £ to £ a month. As she has no extra money, she will need to ration the heating and avoid turning it on every dayAmanda Buttons gas bill is going up from £ to £ a monthByRos Wynne JonesReal Britain columnistMaryam QaiserFeatures Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments In Amanda Button’s home, the heating only goes on for one to two hours on very cold days. After yesterday’s announcement that  million households will face record increases to energy bills, she will ration it further.“I’ve already been told my gas is going up from £ to £ a month,” she says. “There’s no extra money so I will just have to put the heating on every two to three days now. I already wear my coat, scarf and gloves inside for some of the day.” Amanda is disabled following a car accident in , and she was lucky to survive. The cold causes her pain. “I even know when the cold is coming,” she says. But she has already cut back on everything .“Food is already more expensive so it’s hard to save money there, and I recently lost the £ uplt to Universal Credit. I haven’t had takeaways or holidays for years.” Liza Bradbury, , a healthcare rehabilitation worker from Grimsby, Lincs, bought her teenage sons fleece bedding and pyjamas as their Christmas presents so she could turn her heating down. “I use a community shop for low-price food, and I’ve been trying to change my job because my journey to Hull costs money each day,” she says. In Coventry, shop worker Claire Cunningham, , lives with her disabled dad and her four children. “Sometimes it feels like I am choosing to keep the house warm, keep the lights on, and make fresh, healthy food for my children,” she says. “I make sure I get the food shopping first, and I’m left with very little money at the end. It is so scary. I am drained, I’m having sleepless nights, we don’t do anything as a family any more. The electricity is my biggest worry.” After two years withstanding the economic and emotional pain of Covid, households were hit with a % increase yesterday to the energy price cap. The same day as Shell – cashing in on those rocketing markets – posted  profits of £.billion, making the moral and economic case for Labour’s proposed windfall tax.  Coming at the exact same moment as an interest rate rise, a VAT increase and soaring food prices, this is a Molotov cocktail of price hikes for ordinary families. For those on prepayment meters like Amanda, the price cap will rise from £, to £, – an increase of £. Millions more will pay an extra £ a year on their energy bills from April, Ofgem has said. In low-income households, fuel already makes up far more of the bills total. Everything except essentials is already pared back to the bare minimum. Tracey Herrington, a project manager at Thrive Teesside, which supports low-income communities to bring about change, puts it simply. “There’s nothing left to give,” she says. “People in our community are already choosing between heating and eating. They are already sitting in blankets at home. There’s a fuel crisis, food prices crisis, National Insurance crisis. How many crises can you have  People can’t even afford the bus fare to get to the foodbank or somewhere warm that can help them. It’s desperation.  “These are scary times. We’re going to see an upsurge in mental health problems as people get even more isolated. We’ll see social anxiety, and yes, malnutrition.” She sounds tired and frustrated. “We knew this was coming,” she says. “We knew.” Launching a support package worth £ per person, the Chancellor was keen to talk about the global causes of the cost of living crisis yesterday – last year’s cold winter, the lack of wind. But these “leaves on the line” excuses belie a series of heartless decisions by the Government.It was Rishi Sunak who chose to end the uplt to Universal Credit. It was Sunak who will increase VAT. It was his government that has failed to regulate the energy market or to hold gas in reserve. It was his government who allowed Shell’s £.billion profits slide without a windfall tax, while the French government yesterday announced it would tax energy €.billion to cover the increase in price rises. It’s the Tories who have written off £billion in PPE contracts and £.billion in Covid loan fraud that could have cancelled the VAT hike. The cost of living crisis has been thundering down the track while the Government has been mired in Partygate. The Prime Minister has been fiddling the rules while Rome burns.As Shadow Chancellor Rachel Reeves told Sunak yesterday in the Commons: “The Conservatives aren’t solving the cost of living crisis because the Conservative Party are the cost of living crisis.” National Energy Action CEO Adam Scorer says the Government failed their “exam question” – “How to protect the most vulnerable from a devastating rise in the cost of energy”.Amanda Button was as unimpressed as Reeves by Sunak’s rescue plan of £ to be clawed back over five years. “What the Chancellor’s offering is, I’m sorry, it’s a drop in the ocean,” she says. “As for Boris Johnson, don’t even start me on him.” As we approach the second anniversary of the coronavirus lockdown, communities have been holding on, often by their fingernails, for two years. Only to find that economically, there was worse to come.Yesterday Citizens Advice issued a “red alert” on rising costs. That was before the Bank of England announced a second back-to-back rise in interest rates in  months. One that it warned could lead to the biggest fall in living standards since comparable records began three decades ago.  Foodbank volunteer Michael Drinan, , from London, puts it this way. “The system is broken, and the Government doesn’t have a clue,” he says. “The price hikes will affect the lowest working people, not the Sunaks of the world.” With prices outstripping wage rises and a National Insurance raid to come in April, families are now facing a squeeze greater than during the financial crisis, while the oil giants get richer, and the Tories look increasingly out of touch. As Michael adds drily: “The only time they see a fridge empty is when they buy a new one.”For help contact Christians Against Poverty for free advice on    or at capuk.orgRead MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Labour PartyCitizens Advice BureauNational Insurance Company Ltd.Conservative PartyBoris JohnsonEnergyEnergy billsInterest ratesLiving standardsMental healthPrice risesChristmas partyCoronavirusDaily Mirror" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: i went cold handed 109000
story: Exclusive: I went cold when I was handed £, cladding bill after already paying £,EXCLUSIVE: Rachael Loftus, , from Leeds, said she and her neighbours are completely trapped as the flammable cladding on their building means their flats are worthlessRachael Loftus has already forked out £k for fire safety measures and she now faces a £k bill Image: Rachael LoftusByMatthew DreschNews Reporter:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments A woman said she aposwent coldapos after she was handed a £, bill for cladding removal and other fire safety work on her flat.Rachael Loftus, , from Leeds, is one of many Brits being forced to pay to remove cladding from her home in the aftermath of the Grenfell Tower fire. She has already been forced to pay out £, on ious safety measures, including hiring workers to act as a aposwaking watchapos for fires. The health worker and her neighbours have now received huge bills for the upcoming removal of timber cladding on their block of flats. Although they do not have to pay immediately, the charge sent a shot of apospanicapos through the leaseholders in Timble Beck building.  Rachael, who bought her two-bed flat in , told The Mirror: When I got the bill on Monday I just went cold. It induced panic in everyone in the building. We have lived in fear of it for some time, itaposs draining to live like this all the time. We are completely trapped. There are people living here with children who want to move to have a garden but they canapost. Thereaposs one couple who want to get orced but they havenapost been able to make that separation as they canapost split their assets.  If we say aposno we wonapost payapos they can repossess our homes and we would still be liable for the costs of the work. Itaposs feudal the way they can make us pay. I would have had more protection in lawI bought a toaster - I would have had consumer rights. Rachael has already spent £k on safety measures, such as the aposwaking watchapos and a fire alarm system, since January . She was able to find the cash to cover the £k, however some of her neighbours are still paying it off in monthly instalments.  The buildingaposs management firm Centrick has now handed Rachael a £, bill for upcoming work. Rachael said the project will install fire breaks and remove the following: flammable insulation, polycarbonate material in the stairwell and timber cladding, soffits and balconies. She said: I think sending out the bills was a bullying thing, they are hoping that because these are in our names... it will be a way of cowering us into paying. Rachael hopes that some of the cost -not all - will be covered by the Government after an application was made for more than £million to the Building Safety Fund on behalf of residents. My share would be £,. We think we will get some of it but we donapost knowit will be half or how much, she said. Rachael was charged £, for the application - on top of the £k she has already paid out.  Leaseholders at Timble Beck building were first hit with hefty bills after an aposadvice noteapos was issued following the fatal Grenfell Tower fire in . Rachael said: The fire service said itaposs two years since Grenfell and no-one has done anything. They thought the advice note would force freeholders to do an assessment but it led to freeholders saying wehad to pay. West Yorkshire Fire and Rescue Service told Centrick it needed to introduce a aposwaking watchapos on the same day officers checked the building, the company previously said. This round-the-clock surveillance only came to an end when a fire alarm system was installed in the block, which is part of the Fearn Island Mills development. Get all the latest news sent to your inbox.for the free Mirror newsletter Rachael bought her flat for £, in  but it is now officially worth £ because of the fire safety issues, she said. She added: It canapost be sold, borrowed against and I wouldnapost be able to release any equity to pay for the cladding bills until after the works are completed. A spokesman for Centrick said: We sympathise with leaseholders as this is a terrible situation which neither they nor Centrick have caused. Centrick have been actively taking steps, in line with Government guidance, to make sure that the building is made safe as quickly as possible, and that the correct measures have been put in place to try protect leaseholders from the costs. They added: An application has been made to the Government’s Building Safety Fund for the cost of remediating the combustible materials in the external walls of the building. Although we have sent bills to leaseholders showing the full estimated cost of the remediation work we also gave clear assurances, both prior to and with the bill, that the costs for the works do not need to be paid at this time pending the outcome of the funding application. These charges are separated and clearly identiable from the usual service charges on the bill so that it is clear what payments are due now. Any funds that are received from a successful application will be credited to the service charge funds and leaseholdersapos accounts will be adjusted accordingly. The spokesman said leaseholders in the building had to pay for the aposwaking watchapos as it was not possible to claim the cash back from the Government. news uk-news kate-middleton-announces-rare-solo-"Kate Middleton helps children with artwork in LuxembourgByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments The Duchess of Cambridge is set to carry out an exciting overseas trip where she will celebrate the Queenaposs Platinum Jubilee.Kensington Palace revealed that Kate will be flying solo when she travels to Danish capital Copenhagen for a two-day visit on February  and  without husband Prince William.During the trip she will pay tribute to the historic ties between Britain and Denmark and be received by the countryaposs Queen Margrethe II, who is also celebrating her Golden Jubilee this year. In addition, Kate will also join Crown Princess Mary of Denmark to visit a project which works to protect vulnerable women and children from domestic violence and use the trip as a fact-finding mission for her Royal Foundation Centre for Early Childhood. It is the first time that Kate will bring the centreaposs work on to the international stage and on the trip and she hopes to learn from Denmarkaposs example as a country widely recognised as a world leader in its approach and investment in early childhood development. Kensington Palace says: During her visit, Her Royal Highness will spend time learning about how Denmark has created an enabling culture for early childhood development, specically how it has promoted infant mental wellbeing alongside physical health, and how it harnesses the power of nature, relationships and playful learning in the first five years of le. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up .Her programme will focus on innovative initiatives and projects which support children in their growth, particularly their social and emotional development, as well as their parents and wider communities surrounding them. In a personal tweet, the duchess said: “Looking forward to learning from experts, parents  practitioners about Denmark’s approach to early childhood later this month. “Denmark is a beacon of best practice in its approach to the early years, with a culture which prioritises the best start in le.” She ended the message with the Danish words “Pa snarligt gensyn”, which translate as “See you soon”, and the letter “C” to denote a personal tweet.  Kate launched her Royal Foundation Centre for Early Childhood, stating she wants to “raise awareness of why the first five years of le are just so important for our future le outcomes”.And she has been a driving force behind a landmark study on perceptions of early childhood. The trip will come weeks after Prince William embarks on a solo trip as he is travelling to Dubai on Thursday for an overseas visit.Meanwhile, the past two days have been busy for Kate with two royal engagements and the announcement she is taking on a new job.  On Wednesday, it was revealed she is now the patron of the English Rugby Football League and Rugby Football Union - two roles previously held by Prince Harry. To mark her new jobs, she paid a visit to Twickenham yesterday, when she tackled a rugby training session. Meanwhile yesterday, she headed out and about with Prince Charles and Camilla for a rare day out. They visited Trinity Buoy Wharf, a centre in East London run by the Princeaposs Foundation, where traditional textile skills are taught.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Kate Middleton, Duchess of CambridgePrince WilliamRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: national lottery voucher offer deal
story: Get a £ voucher* for the UKs best attractions using a National Lottery ticketYou can use a Lotto ticket to claim a £ voucher* to redeem when booking any one of hundreds of attractionsAdvertorialByDave MastersDigital Commercial Editor:,  Jan Updated:,  Feb Whether you’re eight or , exploring new places brings out the adventurer inside us all.And in the UK we’re spoiled for choice, with hundreds of incredible attractions to fire up the imagination.Thrill seekers of all ages will find adrenaline-filled rides at Zip World or Legoland. Those who prefer a more relaxing experience can enjoy autumn’s spectacular show of colours at venues like Kew Gardens, Cardf Castle or RHS Garden Bridgewater – a major horticultural project near Salford. History fans will adore a trip to the gothic ruins at Whitby Abbey, Warwick or Stirling Castle, while animal lovers can meet Ruby the red panda, born in July at Edinburgh Zoo, or three adorable tiger cubs at Highland Wildle Park. Click here toabout National Lottery Days Out and redeem your £ voucher*. And you can use a Lotto ticket purchased on or after October ,  to claim a £ voucher* to redeem when booking any one of hundreds of attractions. Not only will you enjoy a discounted day trip, you can feel proud that you’ve helped fund many of the tourist and heritage sites that make the UK unique. By playing The National Lottery, you raise £million for good causes every week.  National Lottery players have supported  of the top  most visited tourist attractions in the UK**, from castles to wildle parks, botanical gardens to museums and plenty of other fun stuff. Every adventure starts with a finger on a map. So where will yours land Highland Wildle Park: Meet animals from all over the worldGet up close to some endangered animals from the world’s mountains and tundra in the stunning setting of the Cairngorms National Park. From the comfort of your car you’ll encounter bison, elk and red deer – then visit the tigers and polar bears on foot using the park’s trails. Many nativeanimals are here too, including the capercaillie, European grey wolf, wolverine, lynx, Scottish wildcat and beavers. Cardf Castle: Enjoy a great day in history It has a history that stretches back to Roman times, a keep dating from the Norman Conquest, a spectacular moat and great views over the city that sits just beside it. Cardf Castle makes for one brilliant family day out. You’ll learn that it was once home to the world’s richest man, and was used as a giant air raid shelter during the Nazi bombardment of the city. Kids will love standing beside the huge replica trebuchet – a six-ton medieval weapon built for a movie that was filmed at the castle. After you’ve toured the building, stroll around its beautul grounds, or explore the city itself.Stonehenge: Explore this wonderful World Heritage Site Get close to this mysterious monument that dates back nearly , years. This awe-inspiring embodiment of human ingenuity offers a direct connection to our ancient past, and is a bucket-list destination for visitors around the world. Click here toabout the National Lottery Days Out and redeem your £ voucher*.  *Subject to availability. One voucher per person. + only. See NationalLotteryDaysOut for full TsCs.**Source: the Association of Leading Visitor Attractions, . title: newlyweds transform 4000 double decker
story: Newlyweds transform £, double decker bus into dream home - it even has a log fireGareth and Lamorna Hollingsworth met while travelling and spent a year on the road on honeymoon - they have now decided to get the wheels in motion again after buying a very dferent new homeThe couple decided against building their own home - so went for a double decker bus instead! Image: mediadrumAndrewCrowleyBySam Elliott-GibbsReporterChloe Shakesby:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments A newly-married couple bought a double decker bus online after a sinking a few glasses of wine - and transformed it into an incredible dream home complete with a log fire.Gareth and Lamorna Hollingsworth met when they were both travelling abroad and quickly fell in love.But the adventures and road trips are just beginning thanks to the Hereford coupleaposs spur-of-the-moment eBay buy.In , the couple got married and went on a year-long honeymoon travelling the world in a camper van. But when they got back, they realised that they didn’t want to stop hitting the road together - so they logged on and bought a  double-decker Scania bus for £,. “On ourfrom a truly epic honeymoon, talk turned quickly to the idea of buying a larger van and seeing more of Europe,” said Gareth, . “Talk of vans quickly became talk of buses, and before long - and after a couple of glasses of wine - we bought a double-decker on eBay. “I’ve always wanted to build a house, and the bus was a step in the right direction. “Not an easy one,it was, everyone would be doing it, but we like a challenge. And a challenge it has been, but one that will be worth all the effort. “Think of it as a tiny home, as opposed to a camper van. We chose a bus because we wanted enough space to live in comfortably, but with the ability to move.  “It was also important to us to be completely self-sufficient. Our solar setup gives us nearly four kilowatts of battery storage, enough for almost a weekaposs usage.” Gareth and Lamorna, , have spent nearly two years working on the bus, spending an estimated total of £, on the project. That including purchasing the bus for £,, and another £, on solar power and batteries, and £, on getting the right driving licence. The renovation involved entirely stripping the bus of its old floors, ceilings, walls and radiators, adding in fresh ones - as well as a water tank to allow for everyday living.  The bottom floor of the bus contains a fully-ing kitchen, with a full-sized oven, sink, and fridge-freezer, as well as a slide-out pantry and overhead kitchen storage, plus a log fire to keep the double-decker warm, and of course, a composting toilet and shower. Upstairs is a multi-al office and lounge area, plus a double bed and purpose-built wardrobes, with solar  on the roof. “Every job takes longer than you think,” said Gareth. “Nothing is square, nothing is level, every wall is curved and you can say goodbye to a spirit level as the bus isn’t parked on level ground.  “We have repurposed where possible, recycled, shopped around online and done all the work ourselves to keep to budget.They now document their journey on their Instagram account @we_bought_a_double_decker.Gareth and Lamorna are currently living in a trailer next to the bus along with their dog Maya, who will be joining them on their double-decker journey. “We wouldnapost be without Maya now, evenshe brings muddy paw prints into the bus,” said Gareth. “We will actually have more room in the bus when we move in soon. Every aspect has been painstakingly thought through to the smallest detail.  “Space is a premium, and we have to really think outside the box to ensure we make the most of it. “For instance, rather than just having a door to our bedroom, instead we have built a bookcase which doubles up as the door, opening on secret hinges by pulling the right book.” The pair get ‘itchy’they spend too long without travelling, and are looking forward to getting back out on the road. The eventual plan is to settle down in Spain or Portugal, but for now, they’re simply excited to get going. “Most people are either envious or think weaposre mad. There are so many issues with driving double-deckers - but the challenge is part of the fun,” said Gareth. “So many people feel stuck with large mortgages or unsatisfactory jobs. “We will be mortgage-free, have a house on wheels, and be free to see the world and enjoy its delights.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Public transportproperty news" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts from our Property Market newsletterSubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: pregnant nursery worker sacked after
story: Pregnant nursery worker sacked after bosses askedkeeping baby was a good ideaAfter successfully suing Stepping Stones Nursery in Hoddlesden, Lancashire, Darci Topping has been told she can expect a "signicant" settlement following the employment tribunal hearingDarci Topping fell pregnant with son Stanley in  and told the tribunal she was fired after informing bosses of her happy news Image: LancsLiveBySam Elliott-GibbsReporterTom EarnshawNeil Shaw:,  Feb |comments A boss who asked a pregnant employeekeeping her baby was a good idea before sacking her weeks later will be forced to pay signicant compensation.Darci Topping has now won an employment tribunal after challenging the Stepping Stones Nursery, LancashireLive report.The -year-old was fired after telling the line manager Zara Costello she was expecting one week into the job.The hearing heard how she had then been the subject of negative inferences - and was even grilled about the babyaposs father, andshe intended to go through with the pregnancy. But the minimum wage worker was then apospressuredapos into reducing her hours as the coronavirus pandemic hit before being made redundant in a shock move. The Manchester tribunal heard how the minimum wage worker was then pressured into reducing her hours before being made redundant. The tribunal ruled that bosses at the nursery, located in Hoddlesden, Lancashire, had dressed up her sacking with a sham process because she was having a child. Darci has since welcomed son Stanley and will be compensated after suing for pregnancy discrimination and unfair dismissal. The tribunal report said: A few days later, in the course of a discussion about her pregnancy, Ms Costello told her that Julie Mercer, the owner of the nursery, would aposcome round to itapos, and she mentioned the fact that Miss Topping was on probation. Other comments were made, including questions about whether Miss Topping was, in fact, going to keep the baby and whether that would be a good idea, and reference was made to Miss Toppingaposs partner or father of the baby at the time. Stepping Stones Nursery became worried about finances as the reality of Covid hit, with Darciaposs hours cut to  a week without consultation. She was forced to sign a hastily typed up document agreeing to cutting her hours - but was the only worker to have her shts formally cut. Darci was anxious over the pandemicaposs impact on her health and whether or not she would have a job, the tribunal heard. She was placed on sick leave initially but then placed on furlough as well as other members of staff. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  However, she was the only one to receive % of wages for  hours a week, rather than . And despite things being stable at the nursery, she was made redundant out of the blue while on furlough, leaving her very upset. Ms Costello even suggested she might be better off on benefits during the telephone call. The report said: By April , , the numbers of children attending the nursery each day had stabilised. Miss Topping was by then on furlough with other employees at no cost to the nursery. What happened then was that Ms Costello simply rang up Miss Topping and announced her dismissal as . From the evidence presented, the Tribunal considered that the nursery dressed up her dismissal by constructing a redundancy process which either never took place or took place after the nursery made its decision to dismiss her. Darci launched legal action, claiming the nursery had a problem with pregnant employees. Employment Judge Marion Batten said: The Tribunal concluded that the decision to make her redundant was a decision targeted at her alone – she was pregnant and in light of the paucity of the evidence, it was apparent that was the only dference. There was no other credible explanation offered by the nursery. The Tribunal had no hesitation in concluding that her dismissal was related to her pregnancy. Only she was dismissed. She was the only employee who was pregnant, and in the context of her treatment by the nursery since she told them, at the beginning of March , that she was pregnant. Following the case, Darci said she is glad to have won the tribunal. She added: It was very tough for me being made redundant at such a vulnerable point in my le while expecting my first baby which I wanted to be excited about. I do feel that I have got justice and I am relieved that the case is finally over. A compensation hearing will take place later this month. I love the way she carries herself, she is very classyapos - Iaposd known Chris for years and I was the one who took her to the party. The dancefloor was by the swimming pool and there were many beautul girls flocking to Andrew, but he was completely focused on Chris.  I felt it was not my business to say she was dating someone  and she danced with Andrew for most of the evening until the party ended at about am. He followed her everywhere she went, even to the bathroom, and at one point he gave her a head massage. news uk-news prince-harry-says-workload-leaves-"Prince Harry says that mental fitness is the pinnacleByRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Feb |commentsPrince Harry says his workload and commitments often leave him feeling burned out. The Duke of Sussex - who has signed several multi-million pound deals since quitting the Royal Family - said he still has hard days but is schooled by the universe.During a chat with US company BetterUp, the -year-old said all employees should be given time to build their mental fitness. Harry was able to take five months off when his daughter Lilibet was born last year. He wants to see bosses allocating -minute white space breaks each day for staff to relax, while admitting: I too experience burn-out.  Iaposm burning the candle at both ends and thataposs like, boom. Harry advocates meditating every day, and said he is able to schedule around half an hour or  minutes for it while son Archie is at school.Despite sharing an £million mansion in Santa Barbara, Calorniaaposs lavish Montecito community with we Meghan Markle, the Duke says he still misses out on things he would love to do. This is due to the stresses he faces. I know I need to meditate every single day, he said. Harry likes to take a lesson from anything negative, which helps him be more resilient to leaposs challenges.  Some days are great, some days are really hard, he said. Iaposm always kicking myself - aposIf youaposd have done this, which you know works for you, you wouldnapost be in this state now.apos Itaposs work, but of all the work thataposs pulled towards us, itaposs the most fulfilling work - apart from being a dad, he added. It comes after a royal expert said Harry is laying low for now and doesnapost want to cause any more upset for his family back in Britain.Since stepping down as a senior working royal and moving to America with Meghan, Harry has made several claims against his family.In March last year, he and Meghan sat down for a bombshell chat with Oprah Winfrey, where they alleged there had been conversations about how dark their son Archieaposs skin would be before he was born. Harry also revealed a rt between him and his brother, Prince William and he told how he felt really let down by his father, Prince Charles, and had been cut off financially by the royals.He also lashed out at Charles on the Armchair Expert podcast and the Apple series The Me You Canapost See.But with Harryaposs beloved grandmother the Queen suffering health issues last year and her Platinum Jubilee celebrations coming up, royal expert Katie Nicholl says he will try to keep things calmer. Katie told Closer magazine : Whether Harry has regrets or not, I don’t know, but what I do know is that he has a history of lashing out at the establishment before. He’s talked about his aposaccident of birthapos and the aposburden of the crownapos.He’s been critical in the past, but then goes quiet. I think since last year he’s paused and reflected. And he’s realised how much last year took a toll on his grandmother, and doesn’t want to cause any more upset, so is laying low for now. title: rash could sign omicron covid
story: Rash could be sign of Omicron Covid iant – heres what to look out forIn addition to the three classic Covid symptoms, the ZOE Covid App has identied two common types of rashes in some of those who have tested positive for coronavirusSome people are reporting a rash as a symptom of Omicron Image: Getty Images Cultura RFByAriane Sohrabi-ShirazSEO Editor:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsThe coronavirus R rate is slowly creeping up, and according to the latest data from the UK Health Security Agency , the number is now between . and . in England.Data shows that one in  people in England currently have Omicron, which is the dominant iant in the country.As Covid cases are on the rise, itaposs important to be aware of the symptoms of Omicron to avoid further spread.Brits will be well aware of the three aposclassicapos Covid symptoms – a new, continuous cough, a fever and loss of taste and or smell, which were identied by the NHS at the start of the pandemic.However, as more Omicron cases have emerged, experts have identied other signs that may signal infection. One of these warning signs can show up on a personaposs skin – hereaposs what to look out for. Warning sign on your skin to look out for  Some people who have tested positive for Omicron have reported rashes appearing on the skin, according to the ZOE Covid Study app. However, itaposs important to remember that having a rash does not mean you have Covid on its own. You should always take a Covid testyou think you may have coronavirus. There are a couple of dferent iations of rashes you should look out for.Described as a fourth key sign of coronavirus, the first is a hive-type rash that comes suddenly in the form of raised bumps on your skins.Brits will be well aware of the three main symptoms of coronavirus – a new, continuous cough, a fever and a loss of taste and or smell. These are the officially recognised symptoms according to the NHS. However, with the new Omicron iant, symptoms have been described as being more similar to a common cold. Itaposs important to be aware of the symptoms in order to limit the spread of Covid. most common symptoms of Omicron, overtaking the  aposclassicapos Covid symptoms Is a rash a symptom of Omicron  Is altered taste a symptom of Omicron  Warning in your eyes doctor warns could be sign of Omicron Warning signs that the Omicron symptoms youaposre experiencing arenapost mind Omicron symptoms parents may be able to spot in children  least pleasant Omicron symptom – including dizziness  These tends to be very itchy and often start with intense itching of the palms or soles. Another is prickly heat, which comes on as areas of small, itchy, red bumps. These can appear anywhere on the body, but tend to be most commonly found on elbows, knees and the backs of hands and feet.The ZOE Covid app adds: There are other, less common, rashes associated with Covid- including Pityriasis Rosea-like, light-sensitive rashes affecting the face or neck.Vasculitis rashes, when small blood vessels in the skin become damaged, are also seen in severe cases of Covid- that need hospital support. What are the other symptoms of Omicron   Experts have likened Omicron symptoms to milder infections, such as a common cold. According to the ZOE Covid app, the most common symptoms of Omicron found from their analysis was:Runny nose Headache FatigueSneezing Sore throatIf you have any symptoms of Covid, including the three aposclassicapos symptoms, you should get a Covid test. If you have symptoms you should self isolate until you have a negative result. title: schoolgirl tries score free sick
story: Schoolgirl tries to score free sick day by drawing dodgy fake Covid testFive-year-old Una Harstard wanted to have a day off school like her sister Summer so hatched a plan to try and convince mum Emma to let her join their duvet dayUna Harstard, five, drew a fake lateral flow test in felt tip pen Image: Kennedy News and MediaByLaura SharmanNews Reporter:,  Feb |comments A crafty schoolgirl drew a fake positive lateral flow test in a failed bid to score a sick day and spend the day at home.Una Harstard, five, was jealous that seven-year-old sister Summer Harstard was taking the day off due to a cold so came up with a cunning plan so she could join her and mum Emma Grigg, . The year one pupil carefully drew and coloured in the pretend test with felt tip and presented it to her mum on Thursday in the hope she would get to have a duvet day.But her artistic endeavours failed to pull the wool over the marketing workeraposs eyes and Una was marched to school as usual.Emma, from Rainham, Kent, said: Summer didnapost feel well so she had to take a test so we can let the school knowitaposs Covid.  Una was jealous her sister was getting to stay home. It always happens,one is off then the other gets jealous. The mum told how she was trying to get Una ready for school while asking Summer to do a test. As I was getting Unaaposs lunch ready and getting her out the door, Una was there with this test drawn on a piece of paper saying she couldnapost go to school, she said. Sheaposs pretty cheeky and she thought I would fall for it. She does sneaky things to get out of school but this is the funniest one. I thought it was funny and quite genius.  Despite Unaaposs efforts, Emma did not fall for the hoax and she was packed off to school. Emma said: She got a bit upset and said it wasnapost fair but I told her sheaposd rather be well and at school than unwell and at home. I do have trouble getting her to school and the teacher practically had to pull her inside but sheaposs fine when sheaposs in there. She would rather spend time at home with me because I work from home so she thinks itaposs unfair. Sheaposs a mummyaposs girl, she wants to spend as much time with me as possible. Emma recalled telling her daughter that it did not look like a positive test but the youngster insisted it was unfair. If she had done it properly, she would have drawn a line on a real lateral flow but I wonapost tell her that because thataposll be the next thing, she added. The mum-of-two admits she made similar attempts to ditch school as a child and found Unaaposs effort so funny she shared it on social media. The post had readers in giggles and racked up more than  interactions with some people sharing their own brazen attempts to bunk off school years ago.  One commentor said: Genius. My five-year-old has gone from screaming blue murder at PCR tests to asking to take a LFT herself because her nine-year-old brother has been off with positive results and she wants a positive so she can stay home too. Another wrote: As a kid I covered my face in talc and faked feeling unwell..... Mum fell for it. I was pulling a blinder, lying on the sofa all day watching TV, pretending to feel sorry for myself when suddenly the dutul mum swooped in for a kiss, only to smell the talc on my cheek. I never regretted something so much as I did in that moment. Emma said people praised her as being a legend and some thought back to the ideas they had when they were younger. She said: When I was younger, I would put my head on the radiator so that my mum would think I had a temperature but sheaposd always know because sheaposd see the line from the radiator on my head. Itaposs typical of her. She goes out of her way to get her own way by any means possible and sheaposs really cheeky. title: student who thought iron deficiency
story: Student who thought she had an iron deficiency discovers she has cancerUniversity student Jessica Mellor, from Sheffield, York, was sleeping for  hours a day and began to suffer from extreme dizziness before a blood test revealed the problemJessica Mellor on holiday before the diagnosis Image: MERCURY PRESSByRosaleen FentonDeputy Features Editor:,  Feb |comments A student who slept for  hours a day was stunned to discover she has cancer - after mistaking her symptoms for an iron deficiency.Jessica Mellor, , from Sheffield, Yorks, initially thought her vegetarian diet might be behind the strange symptoms she experienced, which included extreme dizziness and exhaustion. In her second year of Aerospace Engineering at Leeds University, Jessica found herself struggling to take part in her studies.After a le-saving trip to the doctors, she was stunned to discover that her excessive napping and fatigue were a symptom of chronic myeloid leukaemia.Now, one year on, Jessica is in remission and back in university. Jessica said: I’ve never been a tired person so it was strange for me. Every night, I was sleeping for up to  hours, waking up for only two hours and then having a three-hour nap.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here “I’m a vegetarian, I just assumed I had anaemia or maybe lacking vitamin B – I never would have thought it was something so serious. “I went for a blood test and they phoned me the next day to tell me my white blood count was  times what it should have been. “I was told that I had chronic myeloid leukaemia and it was in the blast stage which is the most aggressive. After her shocking diagnosis, Jess had to stay in hospital for five months whilst undergoing two rounds of chemotherapy. She adds: “I didn’t know how to feel, it was too much to take in. “I felt so much frustration because I had to defer uni for the year and I was stuck in a hospital room so I missed out on a lot.apos She was forced to temporarily quit her studies as she underwent aggressive treatment including a stem cell transplant from her own mum, Kerry Mellor, . During treatment, she was only allowed to see her mum who could not visit her for more than an hour a day. She said: “There wasnapost a match for me on the donation register so my Mum donated even though she was only half a match. “This meant they had to filter out the cells that were a match - it was nice to know I could rely on someone like that. Whilst the transplant was a success and Jess is now on the mend, she still has to take oral chemotherapy daily and is forced to live alone as her low immunity is a risk to her le. She said: “My stem cell transplant means I have to live by myself which means my immunity is really low. “I had to remain shielded becauseI caught any type of virus, I could have died - there were no white blood cells in my body to protect me. Now Iaposm back at university, I have to live alone which people donapost really do at university and I have to watch the Covid levelI want to go outside - itaposs quite lonely. The treatment means my eyelashes and eyebrows are falling out which isnapost nice and affected my self-esteem. Jessica is now looking forward to the next academic year, where she will be allowed to live with her friends again. She said: I donapost know what I would have done without the support from aposYoung Lives vs Cancerapos and my support worker, Harriet Wainwright who has really helped me money wise and getting the help that I needed to carry on at university. She initially wanted to follow an engineering career path however, after her terrying experience, Jessica is thinking about taking her le in a new direction. Jessica said:The experience has changed my le and Iaposm unsureI want to still go down the path my degree is taking me. Currently, Iaposm volunteering with aposMarrowapos - the Anthony Nolan student network which encourages other students to donate stem cells. Rachel Kirby-Rider, Chief Executive at Young Lives vs Cancer said: “Going through cancer when you’re young is le-shattering, you have big plans and dreams and then cancer comes along and puts a line through it all. news uk-news tragic-final-days-octomum-before-"Mandy Allwood and boyfriend Paul Hudson chat outside their homeByEd CullinaneSam Elliott-GibbsReporter:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments The troubled final weeks of tragic aposOctomumapos Mandy Allwoodaposs le have been revealed as she battled alcoholism and flooded her flat before her death from cancer.Neighbours said she really struggled later in her le and revealed her desperate fight with booze as she failed to recover from the trauma of losing her eight children. Mandy made headlines around the world  years ago when she fell pregnant aged  in . Tragically at  weeks, Mandy gave birth to six boys and two girls over three days and three nights - but each of the babies died in a matter of hours. She went on to have three children but neighbours and friends said she never recovered from the trauma of losing her babies. Mandy will be cremated today at a service, with no friends or family present.  Mandy lived in Stratford-upon-Avon, Warwickshire, and her neighbours said the area would be a much quieter place without her. They revealed how she battled booze demons which led to her accidentally flooding her property on several occasions One neighbour, who would only give her name as Sue, said she often helped Mandy when she could as she felt sorry for her. Sue added: I didnapost know her very well because she was a bit of a funny person, she was an alcoholic so she could be a bit in your face. I tried to give her what she needed and help. It was a shame, I felt sorry for her - but it was just too much to handle. It is a bit of a relief. She flooded the flat underneath her when she overfilled her bath. The guy in the flat below couldnapost do anything to stop it. She denied it and wasnapost very helpful - so she was a bit of a mixed character. Heaposs now got to get his flat sorted because she did it three times. It wasnapost that she did it intentionally, she was just so drunk. With this virus too she was constantly coming over to my house and hugging me, and I had to be nice with her but I even had to lock my doors. Once she just came into the flat, she was just so drunk she never knew what she was doing. I know it sounds awful, but itaposs lovely around here and now sheaposs gone itaposs a bit better. Mandyaposs home could be seen today covered in elaborate, chaotic and colourful decorations with her front door labelling her flat the manor. Another neighbour, who did not want to be named, said: She was certainly a character to say the least, but she never recovered from what happened to her. You canapost even imagine the trauma she went through so its understandable I suppose but she did have her struggles with the bottle. It will certainly be quieter around here, she was rather eccentric. Despite her problems, she had a heart of gold. Mandy previously told how she spiralled into depression and suffered with suicidal thoughts in the years after her babies died in her arms. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  But she revealed that secret meetings with Princess Diana, who personally comforted her, is what got her through her darkest days. Mandy said: She came to meet me when I was staying at the Ritz and the Dorchester in London. She was absolutely lovely. I never really got the chance to say thank you to her properly. She gave me a hug, showed me lots of support and told me she liked my dress. When we first met she said to me aposthank you for keeping me off the front pages for a changeapos - it was a massive boost for me. Mandy continued to mark the anniversaries of the death of her children - Kypros, Adam, Martyn, Cassius, Nelson, Donald, Kitali and Layne – by visiting their graves alone. She said: They are always in my mind and I think about them every single day. I have good days and bad days but Iaposm feeling a lot better. I feel happy and positive about the future. Giving advice to other women who had lost babies, she added: You will never ever forget your babies, but donapost be hard on yourself. You will never forget your little boy or girl but you canapost change it. Stay positive and it will work out. news uk-news tragic-le-octomum-mandy-allwood-"Mandy Allwood and boyfriend Paul Hudson chat outside their homeByRosaleen FentonDeputy Features Editor:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsOctomum Mandy Allwood, who lost all eight of her children, has died aged  from cancer - and is set to be cremated today at a service with no friends or family present. She became the most famous mum-to-be after it was announced in  that she was expecting octuplets - and thousands grieved with her when it emerged she had lost them all. Mandy never recovered from the heartbreaking trauma and she still experienced phantom pregnancies two decades later. She was even comforted by Princess Diana after the unlikely pair formed a friendship and met - where they chatted about depression. She gave birth at  weeks to six boys and two girls over three days and three nights in  but none of the babies survived. She never recovered from the trauma of losing the octuplets, who she had named Mandy Kypros, Adam, Martyn, Cassius, Nelson, Donald, Kitali and Layne. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here Controversial deal Mandy was a mum-of-one when she met Paul Hudson in . Desperate to have more children with him, after suffering a miscarriage, she took fertility drugs to boost her odds. The situation was complex, as Paul continued to spend two nights a week with his lover ex, with whom he had two kids. She was injected with two doses of din, designed to stimulate oies without medical supervision - but reportedly ignored advice not to have sex at a critical time in the treatment. Doctors advised her to reduce the number of embryos in order to give the foetuses a better chance of survival - but overjoyed Mandy was desperate to carry all eight babies.  Following her discovery that she was pregnant with octuplets, Mandy went on to hire now-disgraced PR guru Max Clford and signed TV and newspaper deals set to net her more millions This included a deal with the now-defunct News of the World - which the BBC reports allegedly included a controversial clause that must not abort any of the embryos -despite huge concerns for her health and that of her babies. She was reportedly offered £millionall eight babies were delivered safely. Suing Max Clford The controversial PR, later convicted of indecent assault, promised Mandy and Paul huge riches from her pregnancy - but she ended up suicidal and penniless after tragically losing her eight babies. After she fell pregnant, he moved her and Paul, from Solihull, West Mids, to a safe house in South London to stop her talking to other press - but hardly ever visited. And when she suffered her immense loss in early labour where she nearly died twice, she said Clford didnapost care. Instead after five days, she said he arranged for her to move to a hotel before she was flown to America for an interview with Oprah. And the mum was left fuming after an interview with a German TV station where they had reportedly offered Clford £, for her story but he told Mandy it was just £,. She later successfully sued him in  the High Court for making secret profits - and told the Sun she sold her soul to the devil by working with him. Princess Diana meeting Mandy revealed that Princess Diana got in touch with her just five weeks after she lost her children, and said they went on to meet twice. Speaking in  about their meetings, Mandy said the pair enjoyed crab and prawn lunches together in top London hotels. She said: She gave me a hug, showed me lots of support. When we first met she said to me, aposThank you for keeping me off the front pages for a changeapos. We talked about her depression and my panic attacks and she told me she had been there, too. We spoke about her family and she talked a lot about Charles and Camilla. Tragic deaths Mandy unexpectedly went into labour at  weeks, just weeks after the story had first broken. Recalling the nightmare in  in an exclusive interview with the Mirror, she said: I remember it like yesterday. I went to the toilet and as I stood up, the baby shot out on its cord, she says. This tiny baby, fully formed with all its fingernails. I was actually very calm. I got taken to hospital with a police escort and lost two more babies that day. Another was lodged in my back. Iaposve never known pain like it. Over the next two days, she lost her five other babies.She recalled: I looked at them dressed in their babygrows and all I could think of was which one could I have killed  How could I have chosen  I was distraught. When I left the hospital I was so low. It was scary to re-adjust and pick up the pieces in the real world. I just wanted to be on my own. Heartbreaking photos went on to capture the funeral where eight tiny coffins were carried into the church.  Family estrangement The mum didnapost think it would be possible to conceive after the horric trauma she endured but discovered she was pregnant again in  with daughter Colour. Just three months after giving birth, she discovered she was pregnant again and gave birth to daughter Kitali. And in , she gave birth to Rade, by emergency Caesarean at  weeks. The money made from media deals had largely disappeared and she was convicted for two counts of fraud in , after telling banks she was a high-powered executive while on income support. Depression still engulfed her and she told the papers how she tried to take her own le in . Mandy told The People: It was only when I woke in hospital and realised how lucky I was to be alive that I really started to deal with my grief. But she was caught driving three times over the limit while her kids were in the car in  and given an ASBO for playing loud music in , resulting in her losing custody. She battled alcohol addiction, money issues and suicidal thoughts until the end, and remained estranged from her family. Neighbours who lived by her said she never got over the loss. One said: She was certainly a character, to say the least, but she never recovered from what happened to her. You canapost even imagine the trauma she went through so itaposs understandable I suppose but she did have her struggles with the bottle. It will certainly be quieter around here, she was rather eccentric. Despite her problems, she had a heart of gold. Phantom pregnancies Heartbreakingly, Mandy continued to suffer from phantom pregnancies twenty years after her huge loss. She told The Sun: I will never ever be able to forget because I am always thinking about them in my head, but also because I can still feel my babies inside me constantly. Ever since I gave birth I have felt them kicking and moving every day.apos She said the feeling comes under her breastbone and feels like a apossharp stabbingapos. Itaposs horric because it brings back all the trauma every minute of every day when I feel the kicks,apos she added. aposI am sent back to the time of me giving birth Book hope Mandy started to face up to her grief and the other issues that she had plagued her during her le. She told a newspaper in : When I look at myself now and what Iaposve been through itaposs amazing that Iaposm still here. I have beaten anorexia and bulimia, had a failed marriage and a orce, lost my brother and been in dficult relationships. I fell out with my parents, had five miscarriages, suffered the loss of eight babies, had post-natal depression - how much can one person take My le has enough material for an entire series of the Jeremy Kyle Show. If youaposre affected by any of the issues raised in this article, please call the Samaritans for free on  Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Princess DianaMax ClfordNews of the WorldMandy AllwoodParenting" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: tragic teenagers pictured after pair
story: Tragic teenagers pictured after pair found dead in park in suspected suicide pactJack Williams, , and Katherine Powell, , were found by an early morning dog walker at Bothenhampton Nature Reserve near Bridport, Dorset, on January Jack Williams and Katherine Powell were found deadByRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Feb  Two tragic teenagers who are believed to have died as part of a suicide pact have been pictured for the first time.The bodies of Jack Williams, , and Katherine Powell, , were found by an early morning dog walker at Bothenhampton Nature Reserve near Bridport, Dorset, on Tuesday last week . The photo shows the pair outside Cherries cafe and ice cream parlour in nearby West Bay, where Mr Williams lived.An inquest into their deaths was opened on Thursday.An initial post mortem examination has revealed the provisional cause of death for both of them was hanging.Have you been affected by this story  Let us know at webnews@mirrorThe hearing was told both Mr Williams and Miss Powell were known to police and identied by Dorset Police custody system images.They were both single and unemployed, with Miss Powellaposs home address given as Kenilworth, Warwickshire. Coroneraposs officer Grace Monro said both had had recent contact with police.  There are no evidence of third party involvement, she added. Ms Monro said police and paramedics had been called after two unresponsive bodies were found, with both pronounced dead at the scene. The post mortem examination was carried out by Dr Robert Blahut, at Holly Tree Lodge mortuary, Bournemouth.  Both bodies have been released to the families for funerals. Dorset Senior Coroner Rachael Grfin adjourned the inquest at Bournemouth Town Hall until July  for a pre inquest review. Dorset Police has said the deaths are not being treated as suspicious, though investigators were working to establish the circumstances on behalf of the coroner. Detective Sergeant Simon Lee previously said: Our thoughts are with the families and friends of the two young people who tragically died. The force has referred itself to the police watchdog, the Independent Office for Police Conduct , over the matter. According to the IPOCaposs website, one of the reasons a force should refer itself to them issomeone had direct or indirect contact with the police when, or shortly before, they were seriously injured or diedapos and where aposthe contact may have caused or contributed to the death or injury. The Samaritans is available  you need to talk. You can contact them for free by calling  , email jo@samaritans.org or head to the website to find your nearest branch. You matter. news uk-news what-your-cost-living-look-"Rishi Sunak says government will take sting out of price shockByAntony ThrowerNews Reporter:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments Millions of households will see energy bills increase by almost £ from April, Ofgem has confirmed - and now you can see how much you can expect to pay.The energy price cap - the maximum amount Ofgem says firms can charge customers on iable tarfs - has increased, in part because of the pandemic.As a result, people on default tarfs paying by direct debit will experience an eye-watering % rise, as it jumps from £, to £, from April .Prepayment customers will be worst hit, with an increase of £ from £, to £,. The move will affect some  million households and follows a% rise in October . See how much your bills will be using our Cost of Living Calculator Ofgem chief executive Jonathan Brearley said: We know this rise will be extremely worrying for many people, especially those who are struggling to make ends meet, and Ofgem will ensure energy companies support their customers in any way they can. The energy market has faced a huge challenge due to the unprecedented increase in global gas prices - a once in a -year event - and Ofgemaposs role as energy regulator is to ensure that, under the price cap, energy companies can only charge a fair price based on the true cost of supplying electricity and gas. Ofgem is working to stabilise the market and over the longer term to ersy our sources of energy which will help protect customers from similar price shocks in the future. An announcement on theenergy price caphad been due next week but was brought forward to today.The price cap sets a limit on the rates a supplier can charge for each unit of gas and electricity you use and is reviewed twice a year. Gas prices around the world have climbed, owing to the pandemic. As a result of the prices of wholesale gas - which have quadrupled in the last year - suppliers are now passing on the cost to customers.  Several readers have shared their stories on how the new prices will affect them. Ofgem reviews its energy price cap twice a year. The next time it could change is in October, although this might be altered. While wholesale prices have eased, experts say October could bring another rise in the price cap, possibly to an average £, a year.To ‘take the sting’ out of the announcement, Rishi Sunak announced a one-off repayable £ discount and a rebate on council tax bills.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON OfgemEnergyCouncil taxEnergy billsGas prices" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news us-news onlyfans-models-loyal-dad-defends-"Dad has best response to mates rude comment about daughterByLayla Nicholson:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb A loyal dad defended his daughter’s OnlyFans page with a savage response to his mate when he called her a “skank”. Emily, who is open about what she does for a living, was shocked to find out her dad’s friend had discovered her profile on the adult site.The USTikToker , who goes by the name @thtgirlsummer on the , managed to catch her parentaposs reaction oncamera ,the Daily Star reports.When the modelaposs dad received a text from his friend Bill about her adult-themed photos, things could have gone very wrong, but as Emily’s dad already knew about her account, he hit back at his pal Bill with a sassy response. Emily took to TikTok to share the message, as well as her dadaposs brilliant reply. In the first clip, Emily can be seen wearing a pink hoodie and her hand over her mouth as she gasped about Billaposs text. Showing her dad holding his phone, the blonde model zoomed in on the series of messages. Bill first messaged: “Your daughter does OnlyFans. “I know,” the dad bluntly replied. The dadaposs pal then responded: “I just wanted to let you know what a skank she is, I can send proofyou need.” The parent was having none of it so continued to question his mate. He asked: “How did you get hold of her pictures ”  Creepily, Bill responded: “I subscribe to her OnlyFans.” But instead of her dad getting angry at his daughter and siding with Bill, he replied with a brilliantly savage response: “Thanks for supporting her business.” Since being posted, the clip has garnered . million views and , likes. Many people praised the supportive dad, with some even branding him a hero. One person commented: “Literally pays for the service then insults the worker.” Another user added: “Bill really thought he did something. Luckily, your dad gives off immaculate supportive vibes and handled it well.” A third person voiced: “Dad of the year award.” Someone  noted: “Bill was someone your dad used to know. Good job dad.” Meanwhile, a fth person expressed: “I’m glad your dad knows and doesn’t judge you for it. The hero we don’t deserve.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON TikTokSelf Employment" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: parents deny decapitating children 12
story: Parents deny decapitating children,  and , and keeping bodies to show siblingsMaurice Jewel Taylor Sr and Natalie Sumiko Brothwell, from Calornia, face murder charges after the decapitation of their two children, aged  and , and are accused of showing their two siblings the bodiesMaurice Jewel Taylor Sr, , has been charged with murder and child abuse Image: Youtube  LawCrime NetworkByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Feb The parents of two children, aged  and , found decapitated have denied murder and child abuse after allegedly forcing their siblings to see the bodies. Maurice Jewel Taylor Sr, , and Natalie Sumiko Brothwell, , have both been accused of two counts of murder following the deaths of Maurice Jr, , and Maliaka, , in Calornia, it is reported. They have also been charged of child abuse under circumstances or conditions likely to cause great bodily injury or death to two other children who were aged eight and nine at the time.The horric details have been confirmed by the Los Angeles County District Attorney’s Office with the older children decapitated and two younger boys shown their bodies, reported foxla.The two surviving siblings were then made to remain in their bedroom for several days without food.  The two dead children were kned on November , , and their bodies were found at their home in Lancaster, about  miles north of Los Angeles, it is reported. Taylor was arrested in December, , and court proceedings were halted over doubts about his mental capability before restarting, while Brothwell was arrested in September last year. Taylor was working as a physical therapy centre in Santa Monica and was carrying out training sessions online during the Covid pandemic. Clients raised the alarm after he failed to fulfil appointments and that led to the children’s bodies being found. They had been concerned about Taylor’s behaviour in the week beforehand and then the Los Angeles Times reported that clients contacted the fire department over a possible gas leak.Howard Kern, a client of Taylor’s told the newspaper: “I said, ‘I’m concerned’. “We are concerned about a possible gas leak. There are four children and two adults, we are concerned about their safety.” Kern added of Taylor: “Think of the nicest person that you know, then multiply that by five. “He worked so hard to support himself. Unfortunately, we don’t know enough to say what happened or what didn’t happen.” Another said that he was “so reliable, so responsive” and “mellow”.  Other clients also said that Taylor was considered hardworking and reliable. Taylor faces a potential state prison sentence of  years and four months to leconvicted as charged, according to the District Attorneyaposs Office. Brothwell faces the same charges but it is unclear whether she faces the same potential le prison sentencefound guilty. news us-news prince-harry-meghan-markles-celeb-"Prince Harry discusses practices for improving mental healthByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments After quitting the Royal Family two years ago, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle now have a new le in Calornia.As well as their stunning mansion and multi-million dollar business deals, the couple now boast a star-studding friendship circle.Among them is superstar tennis player Serena Williams, who joined Harry yesterday for an online summit, where they talked about mental health. During the chat, Serena revealed her close bond with the prince saying heaposs like her le coach and that they chat for hours.But who are the coupleaposs other showbiz pals, and which friends are they no longer close to  Here we take a look... Serena Williams  The tennis champ has had a long-standing friendship with Meghan and it appears that has now extended to Harry too. Meghan first met Serena in  at the Super Bowl in Miami, Florida.Speaking about their friendship on her former lestyle blog The Tig, Meghan said she and the tennis ace bonded very quickly when playing a game of flag football, which is a iation of American football.Meghan wrote: “We hit it off immediately. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up .“Taking pictures, laughing through the flag football game we were both playing in, and chatting not about tennis or acting, but about all the good old fashioned girly stuff.” Then-actress Meghan and Serena were also snapped together at the  Super Bowl in East Rutherford, New Jersey, and again at the launch of Serenaaposs clothing line during New York Fashion Week in . Serena was at Meghanaposs wedding to Harry in  and also attended her baby shower in New York in . Meghan has also been spotted at the US Open as well as Wimbledon lending her support to Serena when sheaposs been in action. Ellen DeGeneres  Another celeb close to Harry and Meghan is chat show host Ellen DeGeneres along with her we Portia de Rossi.They are neighbours in Montecito, Calornia, and in a recent interview on her show, Meghan revealed how they had all spent Halloween together. Ellen also hinted at how close they were last year, saying sheaposd invited some dancers on to her show at Meghanaposs recommendation. She also leapt to Meghan and Harryaposs defence on her talk show, saying it was not fair seeing them get attacked. She said: They are two of the most down-to-earth compassionate people, theyaposre doing so much good for the world.  Ellen and Meghan struck up a friendship in  after an encounter at a pet shelter, which ended with Meghan taking home Bogart, a Labrador-shepherd mix.Meghan recalled the encounter in an interview in Best Health in , when she said: Now, I donapost know her, but Ellen goes aposIs that your dog aposAnd I said, aposNo,apos and sheaposs like, aposYou have to take that dog.apos And I said, aposWell, Iaposm deciding.apos And sheaposs like, aposRescue the dog!apos Itaposs sort of likeOprah tells you to do something. Iaposm sitting there holding him and sheaposs like aposHave you thought of a name for him yet apos And I said, aposWell, I think Iaposd name him Bogart,apos and sheaposs like aposYouaposre taking the dog home.apos And she walks outside to get into her car but instead of getting in she turns around and comes and taps on the window glass and she yells aposTake the dog!apos And so I brought him home. Because Ellen told me to. Orlando Bloom Last year, Harry spoke of a friendship he has struck up with actor Orlando Bloom, who lives down the road from him in Calornia.Speaking on Dax Shepardaposs Armchair Expert podcast to discuss his mental health struggles, Harry admitted that he regularly texts his new friend, who is dating singer Katy Perry, about paparazzi. He said: Two days ago Orlando Bloom sent me a message because he is just down the road and we sort of keep in contact because of the paparazzi. He sent me a photograph which his security got of this long-haired guy with a beanie on, ear pods on with his massive camera lying in the back of his x truck, blacked-out windows. Orlando later voiced Harry in the satirical cartoon The Prince, and the series came under fire for its portrayal of the royals.During an appearance on Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen, creator Gary Janetti said: I donapost knowHarry has said anything to Orlando about it, but I know before the show premiered, he was aware that Orlando was doing it. Priyanka Chopra  Actress Priyanka Chopra has been a close friend of Meghanaposs - even before the former Suits actress met Harry.The pair first met at an ELLE Women in Television dinner in  and struck up a bond. Soon after, Meghan interviewed Priyanka for her blog The Tig.Meanwhile in , Priyanka wrote an open letter about her friend before the royal wedding and around the same time Meghan made it onto the TIME  list.Priyankaaposs heartfelt note read: More than anything , Meghan is an important influencer in a world that needs strong public figures to respect and look up to. “People the world can be inspired by. Meghan, standing shoulder to shoulder with Harry, will be a princess for the people.” Zendaya and Tom Holland It appears that a new couple in Harry and Meghanaposs inner circle could be Spider-Man stars Zendaya and Tom Holland.It was reported last weekend that Harry and Meghan contacted the acting stars out of the blue and asked for a sit down with the pair despite never meeting them before.The secret meeting is thought to have gone ahead at the Sussexaposs Montecito home. The apparent meet up could have been due to the royals looking to pull in big names for their £million Spoty podcast project which has so far failed to materialise - other than a one-off special.And those they are no longer close to...The Obamas Harry and Meghan seemed to have had a close bond with former US president Barack Obama and his we Michelle. They had been pictured together at sporting events around the world and Michelle and Meghan worked together on a number of projects. But last year, the couplesapos relationship was put under the spotlight after the Sussexes werenapost at the former presidentaposs glitzy th birthday party in Marthaaposs Vineyard. Itaposs unclearHarry and Meghan were not invited, or simply were unable to attend. But itaposs been suggested that their friendship with the Obamas has gone cold.And according to royal expert Camilla Tominey, their absence could have been down to the fact that the former president and first lady do not approve of Harryaposs attacks on the royal family.An insider told Camilla writing in the: The Obamas didn’t like Harry attacking his family. They value family and certainly aren’t the type of people who would want their children talking to the press.Piers Morgan There is no love lost between Piers Morgan and Meghan - but this was not always the case.The pair has been friends after they connected on social media back in . Piers has bragged that he and the former Suits actress struck up a friendship online and that they quickly became in regular contact. When Piers followed the actress on Twitter, she sent him a direct message which read: Well hello there - thanks for the follow. Big fan of yours!They were on such good terms that Meghan would send Piers previews of Suits episodes for him to watch before fans did. Then in the summer of , their friendship progressed with them arranging to meet up for drinks when Meghan was visiting the UK. She met with Piers at his favourite pub - The Scarsdale Tavern in Kensington - and he claims they chatted for hours. Piers then says Meghan went cold and that their drink in Kensington was the last time he ever spoke to her.He explained: She met Prince Harry at the dinner that night, went on a solo date with him the next night, and I never heard from her again. Not a word. I’d been ghosted.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Meghan MarklePrince HarrySerena WilliamsRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you.
